metadata.titleEn: Ground observation dataset of corn biomass, vegetation coverage, leaf area index and plant height at Daman station in the middle reaches of Heihe River (growth period in 2016)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河中游大满站玉米生物量、植被覆盖度、叶面积指数及株高地面观测数据集（2016年生长期）
metadata.description: This dataset is a continuous ground observation data of vegetation coverage (%), biomass (g/plant), leaf area index (LAI) and plant height (cm) of seed corn during the growing period in 2016 at Daman Station ( 38.85551N,100.37223E)in the middle reaches of the Heihe River. Ground observation was carried out in three sample plots.  Biomass observation included fresh and dry aboveground biomass, fresh and dry underground biomass (fresh and dry root weight), vegetation coverage was observed by digital camera, leaf area index was observed by LAI 2200, and plant height was observed by tape measure. The observation period was from May 19 to September 5, 2016, in which LAI started from May 30. Observation parameters were observed every 5 days before July 31 and every 10 days thereafter, and a total of 18 observations (LAI was 9) were carried out during the whole growing period. The dataset can provide data basis for inversion and validation of surface vegetation parameters.
metadata.descriptionCn: 本数据为黑河中游大满站（38.85551N，100.37223E）制种玉米2016年生长期的植被覆盖度（%）、生物量（克/株）、叶面积指数以及株高（厘米）的地面连续观测数据集。地面观测在3块样地开展：其中，生物量包括地上生物量鲜重和干重、地下生物量鲜重和干重（根的鲜重和干重）的观测，植被覆盖度采用数码相机拍照法进行观测，叶面积指数采用LAI 2200进行观测，株高采用卷尺进行观测。观测时间段为2016年5月19日-9月5日，其中LAI自5月30日开始，观测参数在7月31日以前每5天观测一次，7月31后每10天观测一次，整个生长期共开展了18次观测（LAI为9次）。该数据集可为地表植被参数反演和验证提供数据基础。

background: Crop biomass is one of the most important biophysical indicators of crop growth. The accurate and efficient estimation of the regional crop biomass at different growth stages is of great importance in guiding crop management decision making, such as in effective fertilization, water irrigation, weeding, and pest and disease management. In addition, as an important aspect of biomass energy, the accurate estimation of crop biomass contributes to the rational and effective utilization of biomass energy. Moreover, effective estimates of crop biomass during the growing season could play a key role in crop yield prediction. The traditional crop biomass estimation method is mainly based on field measurements, which include destructive field sampling, laboratory drying and weighting. The traditional methods are relatively accurate, but they are labor intensive and time consuming. Moreover, the sparse nature of space makes it impossible to provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales. Thus, it is impossible to acquire the regional crop biomass via ground measurements alone. The satellite remote sensing technique is a unique and useful method for crop biomass monitoring in a repeatable manner due to the valuable information it provides on vegetation parameters, high spatial coverage and long time series, which effectively compensates for the deficiency of traditional biomass estimation methods. Previous studies have revealed that remote sensing is a reliable and effective technique to obtain biophysical and biochemical crop information.
research objective: In this paper, four machine learning models, namely random forest (RF), support vector machine (SVM), artificial neural network (ANN), and extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost) were adopted to estimate the seasonal corn biomass based on field observation data and moderate resolution imaging spectroradiometer (MODIS) reflectance data from 2012 to 2019 in the middle reaches of the Heihe River basin, China.
challenges: This is currently one of the major challenges for agricultural researchers and farm managers.
methods: In this study, the corn biomass was estimated based on daily MODIS datasets with a 500 m spatial resolution combined with long-term ground observation data in the middle reaches of the Heihe River Basin, and four machine learning algorithms, namely RF, SVM, ANN, and XGBoost, were adopted to predict the biomass. Large, relatively homogeneous areas, which mainly functioned as corn growing areas, were selected as the sample sites. According to a field survey of the sample sites, a total of sixteen sites were selected in 2012, and three sites were selected for field measurement purposes every year from 2013 to 2019. One to three plots for each sample site were chosen for further biomass observation, with each plot covering an area of 100 m ×100 m. All selected plants in each plot were collected, and the roots of the corn plants were washed. The fresh weight was measured, after which the plants were transported to the laboratory, chopped into easy-to-dry segments, and dried in an oven at 85°C for 48–72 h until a constant dry biomass was obtained. MODIS MCD43A4 and MOD15A2 products from May to September from 2012 to 2019 were analyzed in this study. The forward feature selection method was implemented to choose the most influential variables, which is an iterative method starting from the condition of no model features. In each iteration, we add a given feature that best improves the model until the addition of a new variable does not further improve the model performance. The RF, SVM, ANN, and XGBoost algorithms were adopted in this study. R software was used to implement the above four machine learning algorithms with the randomForest, kernlab, brnn, and xgboost packages. In this study, the caret package in R software was applied to tune the parameters of the above four machine learning algorithms. The 10-fold cross validation method was implemented to evaluate the performance of the above four machine learning models due to the small number of training samples.
dataset: MODIS MCD43A4 and MOD15A2 products from May to September from 2012 to 2019 were analyzed in this study. A total of sixteen sites were selected in 2012, and three sites were selected for field measurement purposes every year from 2013 to 2019. One to three plots for each sample site were chosen for further biomass observation, with each plot covering an area of 100 m ×100 m.
findings: The results indicated that the corn biomass was suitably estimated (the coefficient of determination (R2) was between 0.72 and 0.78) with the four machine learning models. The XGBoost model performed better than the other three models (R2 = 0.78, root mean squared error (RMSE) = 2.86 t/ha and mean absolute error (MAE) = 1.86 t/ha). Moreover, the RF model was an effective method (R2 = 0.77, RMSE = 2.91 t/ha and MAE = 1.91 t/ha), with a performance comparable to that of the XGBoost model.
backgroundCn: 作物生物量是作物生长最重要的生物物理指标之一。在不同生长阶段准确高效地估算区域作物生物量，对于指导作物管理决策至关重要，例如有效施肥、灌溉、除草以及病虫害管理。此外，作为生物质能源的重要组成部分，准确估算作物生物量有助于生物质能源的合理和有效利用。此外，在生长季节有效估算作物生物量可能在作物产量预测中发挥关键作用。传统的作物生物量估算方法主要基于田间测量，包括破坏性田间取样、实验室干燥和称重。传统方法相对准确，但劳动密集且耗时。此外，空间的稀疏性使得在区域或更大尺度上提供全面理解变得不可能。因此，仅通过地面测量无法获取区域作物生物量。卫星遥感技术是一种独特且有用的作物生物量监测方法，由于其提供的植被参数的宝贵信息、高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列，有效弥补了传统生物量估算方法的不足。以往研究表明，遥感是一种可靠且有效的技术，可以获取生物物理和生化作物信息。
research objectiveCn: 在本文中，采用了四种机器学习模型，即随机森林（RF）、支持向量机（SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）和极端梯度提升（XGBoost），基于2012年至2019年中游黑河流域的田间观测数据和中分辨率成像光谱仪（MODIS）反射率数据来估计季节性玉米生物量。
challengesCn: 这是目前农业研究人员和农场管理者面临的主要挑战之一。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，基于每日MODIS数据集（空间分辨率为500米）结合中部黑河流域的长期地面观测数据，估算了玉米生物量，并采用了四种机器学习算法，即随机森林（RF）、支持向量机（SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）和XGBoost，来预测生物量。选择了大面积、相对均匀的区域，主要作为玉米种植区，作为样本地点。根据对样本地点的实地调查，2012年共选择了16个地点，从2013年到2019年每年选择3个地点进行实地测量。每个样本地点选择1到3个样地进行进一步的生物量观察，每个样地的面积为100米×100米。每个样地内的所有植物均被收集，玉米植物的根部被清洗。测量新鲜重量后，将植物运输到实验室，切割成易于干燥的段，并在85°C的烘箱中干燥48至72小时，直到获得恒定的干生物量。研究分析了2012年至2019年5月至9月的MODIS MCD43A4和MOD15A2产品。实施了前向特征选择方法，以选择最具影响力的变量，这是一种从无模型特征的条件开始的迭代方法。在每次迭代中，添加一个最佳改善模型的特征，直到添加新变量不再进一步改善模型性能为止。本研究中采用了RF、SVM、ANN和XGBoost算法。使用R软件实现上述四种机器学习算法，使用randomForest、kernlab、brnn和xgboost包。使用R软件中的caret包对上述四种机器学习算法的参数进行了调优。由于训练样本数量较少，采用了10折交叉验证方法来评估上述四种机器学习模型的性能。
datasetCn: 本研究分析了2012年至2019年5月至9月的MODIS MCD43A4和MOD15A2产品。2012年选择了16个站点，从2013年到2019年每年选择3个站点进行实地测量。每个样本站点选择1到3个样地进行进一步的生物量观察，每个样地的面积为100米×100米。
findingsCn: 结果表明，玉米生物量的估计是合适的（决定系数（R2）在0.72到0.78之间），四种机器学习模型均表现良好。其中，XGBoost模型的表现优于其他三种模型（R2 = 0.78，均方根误差（RMSE）= 2.86 t/ha，平均绝对误差（MAE）= 1.86 t/ha）。此外，随机森林（RF）模型也是一种有效的方法（R2 = 0.77，RMSE = 2.91 t/ha，MAE = 1.91 t/ha），其性能与XGBoost模型相当。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used for estimating crop biomass in agricultural research?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于估计农业研究中作物生物量的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: In the field of agricultural research, a data collection method for estimating crop biomass involves field measurements such as destructive field sampling, laboratory drying, and weighing. This traditional method, although accurate, is labor-intensive and time-consuming. In contrast, satellite remote sensing techniques, such as using MODIS reflectance data, offer a more efficient and comprehensive approach to monitor crop biomass over large areas.
Example.AnswerCn: 在农业研究领域，估计作物生物量的数据收集方法包括破坏性田间取样、实验室干燥和称重。这种传统方法虽然准确，但劳动密集且耗时。相比之下，卫星遥感技术，如使用MODIS反射率数据，提供了一种更高效和全面的方法来监测大面积的作物生物量。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a challenge faced when collecting data for crop biomass estimation in large-scale agricultural studies?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能举一个在大规模农业研究中收集作物生物量估算数据时面临的挑战的例子吗？
Example.AnswerEn: One of the challenges in collecting data for crop biomass estimation in large-scale agricultural studies is the sparse nature of space, which makes it difficult to provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales using ground measurements alone. This limitation highlights the need for satellite remote sensing techniques to compensate for the deficiencies of traditional biomass estimation methods.
Example.AnswerCn: 在大规模农业研究中，收集作物生物量估计数据的一大挑战是空间的稀疏性，这使得仅依靠地面测量很难在区域或更大尺度上提供全面的理解。这一局限性突显了卫星遥感技术的必要性，以弥补传统生物量估计方法的不足。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'vegetation coverage observation method' in the context of data collection for crop biomass?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在作物生物量数据收集的背景下，“植被覆盖观测法”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In this context, 'vegetation coverage observation method' refers to the use of digital camera photography to capture and analyze the percentage of ground covered by vegetation within a specified area. This method provides a visual and quantitative assessment of plant coverage, which is a crucial parameter in understanding crop growth and health.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在此背景下，“植被覆盖观察方法”指的是使用数码相机摄影来捕捉和分析特定区域内植被覆盖的百分比。这种方法提供了对植物覆盖的视觉和定量评估，这是理解作物生长和健康的重要参数。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'remote sensing technique' mean in relation to crop biomass monitoring?
Definition.QuestionCn: “遥感技术”在作物生物量监测中的意义是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: In relation to crop biomass monitoring, 'remote sensing technique' refers to the use of satellite-based tools to collect data on vegetation parameters over large areas. It provides high spatial coverage and long-term data series, allowing researchers to overcome the limitations of traditional field measurements and to estimate crop biomass more comprehensively and repetitively.
Definition.AnswerCn: 与作物生物量监测相关的“遥感技术”是指利用基于卫星的工具收集大面积植被参数数据。它提供了高空间覆盖率和长期数据系列，使研究人员能够克服传统田间测量的局限性，更全面和重复地估计作物生物量。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the accuracy and efficiency of estimating crop biomass using machine learning models with MODIS data compare to traditional field-based methods?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用机器学习模型和MODIS数据估计作物生物量的准确性和效率与传统的田间方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Traditional field-based methods are accurate but labor-intensive and time-consuming, while machine learning models using MODIS data offer a repeatable and efficient approach with high spatial coverage, effectively compensating for traditional methods' limitations. The machine learning models achieved suitable accuracy with a coefficient of determination (R2) between 0.72 and 0.78.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 传统的基于实地的方法虽然准确，但劳动密集且耗时，而使用MODIS数据的机器学习模型则提供了一种可重复且高效的方法，具有较高的空间覆盖率，有效弥补了传统方法的局限性。这些机器学习模型达到了适宜的准确性，决定系数（R2）在0.72到0.78之间。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of regional crop biomass estimation differ when using ground measurements versus satellite remote sensing data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用地面测量与卫星遥感数据进行区域作物生物量估计时，面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Ground measurements face challenges related to labor intensity and limited spatial coverage, making it difficult to obtain regional scale data. Satellite remote sensing data provides extensive spatial coverage and valuable vegetation parameter information, addressing the spatial limitations of ground measurements but may face challenges in accuracy that are dependent on model selection and data quality.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 地面测量面临劳动强度大和空间覆盖有限的挑战，使得获取区域尺度数据变得困难。卫星遥感数据提供了广泛的空间覆盖和有价值的植被参数信息，解决了地面测量的空间限制，但可能面临依赖于模型选择和数据质量的准确性挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the different temporal frequencies of data collection impact the accuracy of biomass estimation models for crops?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同时间频率的数据收集如何影响作物生物量估计模型的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The temporal frequency of data collection can significantly impact the accuracy of biomass estimation models. In the context of the field above, ground observations were conducted with varying frequencies, initially every 5 days and then every 10 days. Such variations can influence the models' ability to accurately capture the growth dynamics of crops like corn, particularly in relation to critical growth stages that might be missed with less frequent data collection. Additionally, the integration of satellite remote sensing data, which provides consistent long-term coverage, helps to complement ground observations and improve overall model accuracy.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据收集的时间频率会显著影响生物量估计模型的准确性。在上述领域，地面观察的频率有所不同，最初为每5天一次，然后改为每10天一次。这种变化可能会影响模型准确捕捉作物（如玉米）生长动态的能力，特别是在关键生长阶段，较低频率的数据收集可能会错过这些阶段。此外，卫星遥感数据的整合提供了一致的长期覆盖，有助于补充地面观察，提高整体模型的准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in using traditional field measurement techniques for crop biomass estimation compared to remote sensing methods?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用传统的田间测量技术进行作物生物量估计相比于遥感方法的潜在挑战有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Traditional field measurement techniques for crop biomass estimation, such as destructive sampling and laboratory drying, are labor-intensive, time-consuming, and limited in spatial coverage. These methods do not provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales, which can be a significant limitation for researchers and farm managers. In contrast, remote sensing methods offer repeatable monitoring with high spatial coverage and long time series, effectively compensating for the deficiencies of traditional methods by providing valuable information on vegetation parameters over large areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 传统的作物生物量估计现场测量技术，如破坏性取样和实验室干燥，劳动密集、耗时且空间覆盖有限。这些方法无法提供区域或更大尺度的全面理解，这对研究人员和农场管理者来说可能是一个重大限制。相比之下，遥感方法提供可重复的监测，具有高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列，有效弥补了传统方法的不足，通过提供大面积植被参数的有价值信息。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the need for integrating ground observation data with satellite remote sensing data in estimating crop biomass?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在估算作物生物量时，整合地面观测数据与卫星遥感数据的需求是什么原因？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The integration of ground observation data with satellite remote sensing data is necessitated by the limitations of traditional biomass estimation methods, which are labor-intensive, time-consuming, and spatially sparse, making it impossible to acquire comprehensive regional crop biomass. Satellite remote sensing provides valuable information on vegetation parameters, high spatial coverage, and long time series, effectively compensating for these deficiencies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 地面观测数据与卫星遥感数据的整合是由于传统生物量估算方法的局限性，这些方法劳动密集、耗时且空间稀疏，无法全面获取区域作物生物量。卫星遥感提供了有关植被参数的宝贵信息，具有高空间覆盖率和长时间序列，有效弥补了这些不足。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors drive the selection of specific machine learning algorithms in crop biomass estimation studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在作物生物量估计研究中，选择特定机器学习算法的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The selection of specific machine learning algorithms in crop biomass estimation studies is driven by their performance in handling the complexity of the data, ability to produce accurate predictions, and adaptability to the available datasets. In the discussed context, algorithms like XGBoost and RF were chosen because they showed high accuracy and effectiveness in estimating corn biomass, as indicated by their performance metrics.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在作物生物量估计研究中，特定机器学习算法的选择是基于它们处理数据复杂性的能力、产生准确预测的能力以及对可用数据集的适应性。在讨论的背景下，选择了XGBoost和随机森林（RF）等算法，因为它们在估计玉米生物量方面表现出高准确性和有效性，这一点通过它们的性能指标得到了验证。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of implementing satellite remote sensing techniques on the efficiency of crop biomass estimation?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 实施卫星遥感技术对作物生物量估计效率的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Satellite remote sensing techniques can significantly enhance the efficiency of crop biomass estimation by providing valuable information on vegetation parameters, high spatial coverage, and long time series. This method effectively compensates for the deficiencies of traditional biomass estimation methods, which are labor-intensive, time-consuming, and spatially limited.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 卫星遥感技术可以显著提高作物生物量估算的效率，因为它提供了有关植被参数的宝贵信息、高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列。这种方法有效弥补了传统生物量估算方法的不足，后者劳动密集、耗时且空间有限。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What is the impact of using a forward feature selection method on the performance of machine learning models in estimating crop biomass?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用前向特征选择方法对机器学习模型在估计作物生物量方面的性能影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The forward feature selection method enhances the performance of machine learning models by iteratively adding features that improve the model until no further improvement is observed. This method contributes to effectively selecting influential variables, thereby improving the accuracy and reliability of the biomass estimation models.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 前向特征选择方法通过迭代添加能够提升模型性能的特征，直到不再观察到进一步的改善，从而增强机器学习模型的表现。该方法有助于有效选择影响变量，从而提高生物量估计模型的准确性和可靠性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to integrate machine learning algorithms with remote sensing data to estimate crop biomass in agricultural research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 将机器学习算法与遥感数据集成以估计农业研究中的作物生物量是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Integrating machine learning algorithms with remote sensing data is important because it allows for the estimation of regional crop biomass across different growth stages, which is crucial for crop management decision-making and biomass energy utilization. Satellite remote sensing provides valuable vegetation parameters, high spatial coverage, and long time series data, which effectively compensates for the limitations of traditional biomass estimation methods that are labor-intensive and time-consuming.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 将机器学习算法与遥感数据相结合非常重要，因为这可以估算不同生长阶段的区域作物生物量，这对作物管理决策和生物质能源利用至关重要。卫星遥感提供了有价值的植被参数、高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列数据，有效弥补了传统生物量估算方法的局限性，这些传统方法通常劳动密集且耗时。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the purpose of adopting multiple machine learning models for predicting seasonal corn biomass in the middle reaches of the Heihe River Basin?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在黑河中游地区预测季节性玉米生物量时，采用多种机器学习模型的目的是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The purpose of adopting multiple machine learning models, such as RF, SVM, ANN, and XGBoost, is to identify the most effective approach for predicting seasonal corn biomass. By evaluating different models, researchers aim to optimize the prediction accuracy and performance, thus contributing to better resource management and decision support in agriculture. The use of diverse models allows for a comprehensive assessment of their capabilities in handling the complex relationships between biomass and various input variables.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 采用多种机器学习模型，如随机森林（RF）、支持向量机（SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）和XGBoost的目的是为了识别预测季节性玉米生物量的最有效方法。通过评估不同的模型，研究人员旨在优化预测准确性和性能，从而为农业中的资源管理和决策支持做出贡献。使用多样化的模型可以全面评估它们在处理生物量与各种输入变量之间复杂关系的能力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific data collection techniques employed to estimate crop biomass using remote sensing and ground observations in agricultural research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在农业研究中，使用遥感和地面观测来估算作物生物量的具体数据收集技术是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques involve using satellite remote sensing for broad spatial coverage and long-term monitoring, combined with field measurements such as destructive sampling and laboratory drying. Ground observations include measuring fresh and dry weights of plant biomass, while remote sensing utilizes MODIS reflectance data to capture vegetation parameters. The integration of these methods helps overcome the limitations of traditional field-based measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集技术涉及使用卫星遥感进行广泛的空间覆盖和长期监测，结合现场测量，如破坏性取样和实验室干燥。地面观察包括测量植物生物量的新鲜和干重，而遥感则利用MODIS反射率数据捕捉植被参数。这些方法的整合有助于克服传统现场测量的局限性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methodologies enable the accurate estimation of crop biomass during different growth stages?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够在不同生长阶段准确估计作物生物量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of traditional field measurements combined with satellite remote sensing techniques enables accurate estimation. Field measurements involve destructive sampling, laboratory drying, and weighing, while remote sensing techniques like MODIS provide high spatial coverage and long time series data on vegetation parameters.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 传统的实地测量与卫星遥感技术相结合，可以实现准确的估算。实地测量涉及破坏性取样、实验室干燥和称重，而像MODIS这样的遥感技术则提供了高空间覆盖率和长期的植被参数数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methods enable the selection of the most influential variables for crop biomass prediction using remote sensing data?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或方法能够选择最具影响力的变量，以利用遥感数据预测作物生物量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The forward feature selection method enables the identification of the most influential variables by iteratively adding features that best improve model performance. This approach, combined with machine learning algorithms, helps in selecting relevant variables from remote sensing data for accurate biomass prediction.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 前向特征选择方法通过迭代添加最能提高模型性能的特征，帮助识别最具影响力的变量。这种方法结合机器学习算法，有助于从遥感数据中选择相关变量，以实现准确的生物量预测。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might traditional field measurement methods be insufficient for comprehensive regional biomass estimation?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 传统的实地测量方法为何可能不足以进行全面的区域生物量估算？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Traditional field measurement methods, while accurate, are labor-intensive and time-consuming. They are limited by the sparse nature of spatial data collection, making it impossible to provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales. These limitations necessitate alternative approaches such as satellite remote sensing techniques, which offer high spatial coverage and long time series data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 传统的现场测量方法虽然准确，但劳动密集且耗时。它们受到空间数据收集稀疏性的限制，使得在区域或更大尺度上提供全面理解变得不可能。这些限制使得需要采用替代方法，例如卫星遥感技术，这些技术提供了高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use both ground observations and remote sensing data in estimating crop biomass?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在估算作物生物量时，使用地面观测和遥感数据的重要性是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Ground observations provide detailed and accurate biophysical measurements, while remote sensing data offer extensive spatial coverage and temporal frequency. Combining these data sources enables a more comprehensive and accurate estimation of crop biomass, effectively compensating for the limitations of using either method alone.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 地面观测提供了详细和准确的生物物理测量，而遥感数据则提供了广泛的空间覆盖和时间频率。结合这些数据源可以更全面和准确地估计作物生物量，有效弥补单独使用任何一种方法的局限性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand what challenges exist in using machine learning models for estimating crop biomass.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在使用机器学习模型估计作物生物量时存在哪些挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: One of the major challenges in using machine learning models for estimating crop biomass is the sparse nature of space, which makes it difficult to provide a comprehensive understanding at regional or larger scales using traditional methods. Additionally, the small number of training samples necessitates careful model validation, such as using 10-fold cross-validation, to ensure accurate and reliable predictions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 使用机器学习模型估计作物生物量的主要挑战之一是空间的稀疏性，这使得使用传统方法在区域或更大尺度上提供全面理解变得困难。此外，训练样本数量较少，需要谨慎进行模型验证，例如使用10折交叉验证，以确保预测的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the process of selecting the most influential variables for crop biomass estimation models.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对选择对作物生物量估计模型最有影响力的变量的过程感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The process of selecting the most influential variables for crop biomass estimation models involves using a forward feature selection method. This iterative approach starts with no model features and adds features that best improve the model's performance, continuing until the addition of new variables no longer enhances the model, ensuring that only the most impactful variables are used.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 选择作物生物量估计模型中最具影响力变量的过程涉及使用前向特征选择方法。该迭代方法从没有模型特征开始，添加能够最佳提升模型性能的特征，持续进行，直到新变量的添加不再增强模型为止，从而确保仅使用最具影响力的变量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the traditional and modern data collection methods used for estimating crop biomass and discuss their respective advantages and disadvantages.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结传统和现代数据收集方法用于估算作物生物量，并讨论它们各自的优缺点。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Traditional crop biomass estimation methods include field measurements such as destructive field sampling, laboratory drying, and weighing. These methods are accurate but labor-intensive and time-consuming, and they cannot provide comprehensive regional data. Modern methods involve satellite remote sensing techniques, which offer high spatial coverage and long time series data, effectively compensating for the limitations of traditional methods.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 传统的作物生物量估计方法包括田间测量，如破坏性田间取样、实验室干燥和称重。这些方法准确但劳动密集且耗时，无法提供全面的区域数据。现代方法涉及卫星遥感技术，提供高空间覆盖率和长期时间序列数据，有效弥补了传统方法的局限性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could be integrated with existing field observation data to enhance crop biomass estimation accuracy.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索可以与现有田间观察数据集成的潜在数据集，以提高作物生物量估计的准确性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include MODIS MCD43A4 and MOD15A2 products, which provide valuable information on vegetation parameters. Integrating these datasets with field observation data and applying machine learning models can significantly enhance the accuracy of crop biomass estimation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括MODIS MCD43A4和MOD15A2产品，这些产品提供了有关植被参数的宝贵信息。将这些数据集与实地观测数据结合，并应用机器学习模型，可以显著提高作物生物量估计的准确性。
